meanings.definition: Of or relating to the earliest ages or periods
meanings.sent1: The primevally forest was untouched by humans.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the primevally rocks to learn about ancient times.
meanings.sent3: The primevally trees whispered ancient secrets to the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her primevally instincts guided her through the dense forest.
meanings.sent5: The primevally landscape painted a picture of the past.

meanings.definition: In a primeval manner or fashion
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins were primevally beautiful.
meanings.sent2: She moved primevally through the dense jungle.
meanings.sent3: The children played primevally in the mud, laughing joyfully.
meanings.sent4: The music echoed primevally through the empty halls.
meanings.sent5: The fire crackled primevally, casting shadows on the cave walls.

meanings.definition: Existing at the beginning of time
meanings.sent1: The primevally creatures roamed the earth when it was young.
meanings.sent2: The primevally landscape was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent3: The primevally stars twinkled in the night sky, unchanged by time.
meanings.sent4: His primevally wisdom was sought after by all who knew him.
meanings.sent5: The primevally mountains stood tall, unmoved by centuries.
